00055 /**

00057  */
00058 class AmazonAAWS extends TarzanCore
00059 {
00060         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00061         // CONSTRUCTOR
00062 
00063         /**
00064          * Constructor
00065          */
00066         public function __construct($key = null, $secret_key = null, $account_id = null, $assoc_id = null)
00067         {
00068                 $this->api_version = '2007-10-29';
00069                 parent::__construct($key, $secret_key, $account_id, $assoc_id);
00070         }

00073         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00074         // CORE FUNCTIONALITY
00075 
00076         /**
00077          * Authenticate
00078          *
00079          * Construct a URL to request from Amazon, request it, and return a formatted response.
00080          *
00081          * @access public
00082          * @param string $action (Required) Indicates the action to perform.
00083          * @param array $opt (Optional) Settings to use for the request.
00084          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00085          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00086          */
00087         public function authenticate($action, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00088         {
00089                 // Determine the hostname
00090                 switch ($locale)
00091                 {
00092                         // United Kingdom
00093                         case AAWS_LOCALE_UK:
00094                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.co.uk/';
00095                                 break;
00096 
00097                         // Canada
00098                         case AAWS_LOCALE_CANADA:
00099                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.ca/';
00100                                 break;
00101 
00102                         // France
00103                         case AAWS_LOCALE_FRANCE:
00104                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.fr/';
00105                                 break;
00106 
00107                         // Germany
00108                         case AAWS_LOCALE_GERMANY:
00109                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.de/';
00110                                 break;
00111 
00112                         // Japan
00113                         case AAWS_LOCALE_JAPAN:
00114                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.jp/';
00115                                 break;
00116 
00117                         // Default to United States
00118                         default:
00119                                 $hostname = 'http://ecs.amazonaws.com/';
00120                                 break;
00121                 }
00122 
00123                 // Send the request to the service.
00124                 $request_url = $hostname . 'onca/xml?Service=AWSECommerceService&AWSAccessKeyId=' . $this->key . '&Operation=' . $action . '&' . $this->util->to_query_string($opt);
00125                 $request =& new $this->request_class($request_url);
00126                 $request->sendRequest();
00127 
00128                 // Prepare the response.
00129                 $headers = $request->getResponseHeader();
00130                 $headers['x-tarzan-requesturl'] = $request_url;
00131                 $headers['x-tarzan-httpstatus'] = $request->getResponseCode();
00132                 $data = new $this->response_class($headers, $request->getResponseBody(), $request->getResponseCode());
00133 
00134                 // Return!
00135                 return $data;
00136         }
00137

00140         // BROWSE NODE LOOKUP
00141 
00142         /**
00143          * Browse Node Lookup
00144          * 
00145          * Given a browse node ID, BrowseNodeLookup returns the specified browse node’s name, children, 
00146          * and ancestors. The names and browse node IDs of the children and ancestor browse nodes are 
00147          * also returned. BrowseNodeLookup enables you to traverse the browse node hierarchy to find a 
00148          * browse node.
00149          *
00150          * @access public
00151          * @param integer $browse_node_id (Required) A positive integer assigned by Amazon that uniquely identifies a product category.
00152          * @param string $response_group (Optional) Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas. Allows 'BrowseNodeInfo' (default), 'NewReleases', 'TopSellers'.
00153          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00154          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00155          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/BrowseNodeLookup.html
00156          */
00157         public function browse_node_lookup($browse_node_id, $response_group = 'BrowseNodeInfo', $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00158         {
00159                 $opt = array();
00160                 $opt['BrowseNodeId'] = $browse_node_id;
00161                 $opt['ResponseGroup'] = $response_group;
00162 
00163                 return $this->authenticate('BrowseNodeLookup', $opt, $locale);
00164         }

00167         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00168         // CART METHODS
00169 
00170         /**
00171          * Cart Add
00172          * 
00173          * The CartAdd operation enables you to add items to an existing remote shopping cart. CartAdd 
00174          * can only be used to place a new item in a shopping cart. It cannot be used to increase the 
00175          * quantity of an item already in the cart. If you would like to increase the quantity of an 
00176          * item that is already in the cart, you must use the CartModify operation.
00177          * 
00178          * To add items to a cart, you must specify the cart using the CartId and HMAC values, which are 
00179          * returned by the CartCreate operation.
00180          *
00181          * Two caveats: (1) Although the Amazon AAWS service allows for adding up to 10 items at once, 
00182          * this method only supports adding one at a time because of how the rest of the API is 
00183          * constructed. (2) The ASIN parameter discussed in the Amazon documentation is not supported 
00184          * in this API. You MUST use OfferListingId instead as this is preferred by Amazon.
00185          *
00186          * @access public
00187          * @param integer $offer_listing_id (Required) An offer listing ID is a token that uniquely identifies an item that is sold by any merchant, including Amazon. This parameter MUST be used as support for Amazon's ASIN parameter is not available in this API.
00188          * @param integer $cart_id (Required) Alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart.
00189          * @param integer $hmac (Required) Hash Message Authentication Code returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart. This is an encrypted alphanumeric token that is used to authenticate cart operations.
00190          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00191          * <ul>
00192          *   <li>string ListItemId - (Optional) The ListItemId value is returned by the ListItems response group. The value identifies an item on a list, such as a wishlist. To add this item to a cart, you must include in the CartAdd request the item's ASIN and ListItemId. The ListItemId attaches the name and address of the list owner, which the ASIN alone does not.</li>
00193          *   <li>boolean MergeCart - (Optional) A boolean value that when True specifies that the items in a customer's remote shopping cart are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart. This occurs when the customer elects to purchase the items in their remote shopping cart. When the value is False (the default) the remote shopping cart contents are not added to the retail shopping cart. Instead, the customer is sent directly to the Order Pipeline when they elect to purchase the items in their cart. This parameter is valid only in the US locale. In all other locales, the value is always False.</li>
00194          *   <li>integer Quantity - (Optional) Specifies number of items to be added to the cart where N is a positive integer between 1 and 999.</li>
00195          *   <li>string ResponseGroup - (Optional) Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.</li>
00196          * </ul>
00197          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00198          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00199          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/CartAdd.html
00200          */
00201         public function cart_add($offer_listing_id, $cart_id, $hmac, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00202         {
00203                 if (!$opt)
00204                 {
00205                         $opt = array();
00206                 }
00207 
00208                 // Convert the required values.
00209                 $opt['Item.1.OfferListingId'] = $offer_listing_id;
00210                 $opt['CartId'] = $cart_id;
00211                 $opt['HMAC'] = $hmac;
00212 
00213                 // Convert quantity to the correct format
00214                 if (!isset($opt['Quantity']) || empty($opt['Quantity']))
00215                 {
00216                         $opt['Quantity'] = 1;
00217                 }
00218                 $opt['Item.1.Quantity'] = $opt['Quantity'];
00219                 unset($opt['Quantity']);
00220 
00221                 // Convert listitemid to the correct format.
00222                 if (!isset($opt['ListItemId']) || empty($opt['ListItemId']))
00223                 {
00224                         $opt['Item.1.ListItemId'] = $opt['ListItemId'];
00225                 }
00226                 unset($opt['ListItemId']);
00227 
00228                 return $this->authenticate('CartAdd', $opt, $locale);
00229         }

00263         /**
00264          * Customer Content Lookup
00265          * 
00266          * For a given customer ID, the CustomerContentLookup operation retrieves all of the information 
00267          * a customer has made public about themselves on Amazon. Such information includes some or all 
00268          * of the following: About Me, Birthday, City, State, Country, Customer Reviews, Customer ID, 
00269          * Name, Nickname, Wedding Registry, or WishList. To find a customer ID, use the 
00270          * CustomerContentSearch operation.
00271          *
00272          * @access public
00273          * @param string $customer_id (Required) An alphanumeric token assigned by Amazon that uniquely identifies a customer. Only one CustomerId can be submitted at a time in CustomerContentLookup.
00274          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00275          * <ul>
00276          *   <li>integer ReviewPage - (Optional) A positive integer that specifies the page of reviews to read. There are ten reviews per page. For example, to read reviews 11 through 20, specify ReviewPage=2. The total number of pages is returned in the TotalPages response tag.</li>
00277          *   <li>integer TagPage - (Optional) Specifies the page of results to return. There are ten results on a page. The maximum page number is 400.</li>
00278          *   <li>integer TagsPerPage - (Optional) The number of tags to return that are associated with a specified item.</li>
00279          *   <li>string TagSort - (Optional) Specifies the sorting order for the results. Allows 'FirstUsed', 'LastUsed', 'Name', or 'Usages' (default).</li>
00280          *   <li>string ResponseGroup - (Optional) Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas. Allows 'CustomerInfo' (default), 'CustomerReviews', 'CustomerLists', 'CustomerFull', 'TaggedGuides', 'TaggedItems', 'TaggedListmaniaLists', 'TagsSummary', or 'Tags'.</li>
00281          * </ul>
00282          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00283          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00284          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/CustomerContentLookup.html
00285          */
00286         public function customer_content_lookup($customer_id, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00287         {
00288                 if (!$opt)
00289                 {
00290                         $opt = array();
00291                 }
00292 
00293                 $opt['CustomerId'] = $customer_id;
00294 
00295                 return $this->authenticate('CustomerContentLookup', $opt, $locale);
00296         }
00297 
00298         /**
00299          * Customer Content Search
00300          * 
00301          * For a given customer Email address or name, the CustomerContentSearch operation returns 
00302          * matching customer IDs, names, nicknames, and residence information (city, state, and country). 
00303          * In general, supplying an Email address returns unique results whereas supplying a name more 
00304          * often returns multiple results.
00305          *
00306          * @access public
00307          * @param string $email_name (Required) Either the email address or the name of the customer you want to look up the ID for.
00308          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00309          * <ul>
00310          *   <li>integer CustomerPage - (Optional) A positive integer that specifies the page of customer IDs to return. Up to twenty customer IDs are returned per page. Defaults to 1.</li>
00311          *   <li>string Email - (Optional) Besides the first parameter, you can set the email address here.</li>
00312          *   <li>string Name - (Optional) Besides the first parameter, you can set the name here.</li>
00313          *   <li>string ResponseGroup - (Optional) Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.</li>
00314          * </ul>
00315          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00316          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00317          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/CustomerContentSearch.html
00318          */
00319         public function customer_content_search($email_name, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00320         {
00321                 if (!$opt)
00322                 {
00323                         $opt = array();
00324                 }
00325 
00326                 if (!isset($opt['CustomerPage']) || empty($opt['CustomerPage']))
00327                 {
00328                         $opt['CustomerPage'] = 1;
00329                 }
00330 
00331                 if (strpos($email_name, '@'))
00332                 {
00333                         $opt['Email'] = $email_name;
00334                 }
00335                 else
00336                 {
00337                         $opt['Name'] = $email_name;
00338                 }
00339 
00340                 return $this->authenticate('CustomerContentSearch', $opt, $locale);
00341         }

00347         /**
00348          * Help
00349          * 
00350          * The Help operation provides information about AAWS operations and response groups. For operations, 
00351          * Help lists required and optional request parameters, as well as default and optional response 
00352          * groups the operation can use. For response groups, Help lists the operations that can use the 
00353          * response group as well as the response tags returned by the response group in the XML response.
00354          *
00355          * @access public
00356          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00357          * <ul>
00358          *   <li>string About - (Optional) Specifies the operation or response group about which you want more information. Allows all AAWS operations, all AAWS response groups.</li>
00359          *   <li>string HelpType - (Optional) Specifies whether the help topic is an operation or response group. HelpType and About values must both be operations or response groups, not a mixture of the two. Allows 'Operation' or 'ResponseGroup'.</li>
00360          *   <li>string ResponseGroup - (Optional) Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas. Allows 'Request' or 'Help'.</li>
00361          * </ul>
00362          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00363          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00364          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/Help.html
00365          */
00366         public function help($opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00367         {
00368                 return $this->authenticate('Help', $opt, $locale);
00369         }

00375         /**
00376          * Item Lookup
00377          * 
00378          * Given an Item identifier, the ItemLookup operation returns some or all of the item attributes, 
00379          * depending on the response group specified in the request. By default, ItemLookup returns an 
00380          * item’s ASIN, DetailPageURL, Manufacturer, ProductGroup, and Title of the item.
00381          *
00382          * @access public
00383          * @param string $item_id (Required) A positive integer that unique identifies an item. The meaning of the number is specified by IdType. That is, if IdType is ASIN, the ItemId value is an ASIN. If ItemId is an ASIN, a search index cannot be specified in the request.
00384          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters. There are a large number available, so check the Amazon documentation page for details.
00385          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00386          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00387          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/ItemLookup.html
00388          */
00389         public function item_lookup($item_id, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00390         {
00391                 if (!$opt)
00392                 {
00393                         $opt = array();
00394                 }
00395 
00396                 $opt['ItemId'] = $item_id;
00397 
00398                 return $this->authenticate('ItemLookup', $opt, $locale);
00399         }
00400 
00401         /**
00402          * Item Search
00403          * 
00404          * The ItemSearch operation returns items that satisfy the search criteria, including one or more 
00405          * search indices.
00406          * 
00407          * ItemSearch is the operation that is used most often in requests. In general, when trying to 
00408          * find an item for sale, you use this operation.
00409          *
00410          * @access public
00411          * @param string $keywords (Required) A word or phrase associated with an item. The word or phrase can be in various product fields, including product title, author, artist, description, manufacturer, and so forth. When, for example, the search index equals "MusicTracks", the Keywords parameter enables you to search by song title.
00412          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters. There are a large number available, so check the Amazon documentation page for details.
00413          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00414          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00415          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/ItemSearch.html
00416          */
00417         public function item_search($keywords, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00418         {
00419                 if (!$opt)
00420                 {
00421                         $opt = array();
00422                 }
00423 
00424                 $opt['Keywords'] = $keywords;
00425 
00426                 // Default to 'All' if nothing else has been sent.
00427                 if (!isset($opt['SearchIndex']) || empty($opt['SearchIndex']))
00428                 {
00429                         $opt['SearchIndex'] = 'All';
00430                 }
00431 
00432                 return $this->authenticate('ItemSearch', $opt, $locale);
00433         }

00439         /**
00440          * List Lookup
00441          * 
00442          * The ListLookup operation returns, by default, summary information about a list that you specify 
00443          * in the request.
00444          *
00445          * @access public
00446          * @param string $list_id (Required) Number that uniquely identifies a list.
00447          * @param string $list_type (Required) Type of list. Accepts 'WeddingRegistry', 'Listmania', 'WishList'
00448          * @param array $opt (Optional) Associative array of parameters. There are a large number available, so check the Amazon documentation page for details.
00449          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00450          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00451          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/ListLookup.html
00452          */
00453         public function list_lookup($list_id, $list_type, $opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00454         {
00455                 if (!$opt)
00456                 {
00457                         $opt = array();
00458                 }
00459 
00460                 $opt['ListId'] = $list_id;
00461                 $opt['ListType'] = $list_type;
00462 
00463                 return $this->authenticate('ListLookup', $opt, $locale);
00464         }
00465 
00466         /**
00467          * List Search
00468          * 
00469          * Given a customer name or Email address, the ListSearch operation returns the associated list 
00470          * ID(s) but not the list items. To find those, use the list ID returned by ListSearch with 
00471          * ListLookup.
00472          * 
00473          * Specifying a full name or just a first or last name in the request typically returns multiple 
00474          * lists belonging to different people. Using Email as the identifier produces more filtered results.
00475          *
00476          * @access public
00477          * @param array $opt (Optional; At least one is Required) Associative array of parameters. There are a large number available, so check the Amazon documentation page for details.
00478          * @param string $locale (Optional) Which Amazon-supported locale do we use?
00479          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00480          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSECommerceService/2007-10-29/DG/ListSearch.html
00481          */
00482         public function list_search($opt = null, $locale = AAWS_LOCALE_US)
00483         {
00484                 return $this->authenticate('ListSearch', $opt, $locale);
00485         }
